thread.title: Live: SP to release its election manifesto shortly
thread.title_full: Live: SP to release its election manifesto shortly

title: Live: SP to release its election manifesto shortly
text:
SP chief Akhilesh Yadav to release the party's election manifesto shortly. #UPElections2017 : Samajwadi party to release its election manifesto in Lucknow shortly. pic.twitter.com/e1FTS6DDPl — ANI UP (@ANINewsUP) January 22, 2017 11:20 AM (IST) UP polls: Congress and Samajwadi Party's alliance for the upcoming polls in the state finalised. 
Congress will get 105 seats 11:18 AM (IST) UP chief minister and Samajwadi Party national president Akhilesh Yadav reaches party office to release manifesto for the 2017 assembly polls 
Elaborate security arrangements are place for Akhilesh's first public appearance after his coronation as SP chief 11:32 PM (IST) BJP releases list of six candidates for upcoming Uttarakhand elections. 09:11 PM (IST) UP polls: BJP declares star campaigners' list minus Advani, Joshi and Varun 
The BJP star campaigners' list for UP elections does not contain the names of LK Advani, Murli Manohar Joshi and Varun Gandhi. Varun Gandhi's absence from the list gives the hint that things are not at comfortable level for him. The names of Rita Bahuguna Joshi, Brijesh Pathak and Jugul Kishore are also not in the list. 07:52 PM (IST) BJP declares 40 names as star campaigners from the party. Sultanpur MP Varun Gandhi's name is missing from the list, while his mother Maneka Gandhi's name has been included in the list. 07:48 PM (IST) Jaitley addressing a public rally in Amritsar Punjab: Union Finance Minister Arun Jaitley addressing a public rally in Amritsar. pic.twitter.com/Qd1KzaCcjz Samajwadi Party blames Congress for failed alliance in Uttar Pradesh: ANI 07:34 PM (IST) BJP indifferent whether the alliance remains or not SP-Cong gathbandhan hone se na BJP ki sehat par asar padne wala hai aur na tuth jane se-Keshav Prasad Maurya, BJP State President #UPpolls pic.twitter.com/Or3yUR5WBg — ANI UP (@ANINewsUP) January 21, 2017 07:08 PM (IST) UP: List of BJP leaders who will be campaigning for the poll Uttar Pradesh: List of BJP leaders who will be campaigning for the party in the upcoming #UPElections2017 pic.twitter.com/U1ZmuuPZBi — ANI UP (@ANINewsUP) January 21, 2017 06:44 PM (IST) Picture will be clear by tomorrow morning (Alliance) ka kal subah tak pata chal jayega: GN Azad, Congress when asked on SP-Cong alliance #UPpolls pic.twitter.com/zAF82nZBhU — ANI UP (@ANINewsUP) January 21, 2017 06:42 PM (IST) Talk is still on ... Baat cheet mein kisi bhi tarah ki koi rukawat nahi hai: Raj Babbar, Congress state President when asked on SP-Cong alliance #UPpolls pic.twitter.com/iRnSxu5m9H — ANI UP (@ANINewsUP) January 21, 2017 06:40 PM (IST) 'Alliance' is almost broken Kareeb kareeb tuth hi gaya hai gathbandhan, UP CM 100 seats de rahe the lekin Cong 120 seat ke niche maan nahi rha tha: Naresh Agrawal, SP pic.twitter.com/BK5ksl4P7j — ANI UP (@ANINewsUP) January 21, 2017 06:39 PM (IST) We told them that we can't contest in less than 300 seats but Cong was adamant as if they are a very influential party in UP. Naresh Agrawal, SP 06:35 PM (IST) Around 140 seats for the first and second phase cleared by the Congress Central Election Committee meeting today: Sources 06:35 PM (IST) SP-Cong alliance unlikely over seat sharing issue; SP offered 99 seats to Cong while Congress demanded at least 115 seats: SP Sources 06:08 PM (IST) Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav offers 99 seats to Congress for alliance in upcoming UP elections 04:34 PM (IST) Arun Jaitley addresses media in Amritsar We're confident of doing extremely well in this election; visualise that we'll bring in a continued era of development in the state: Jaitley pic.twitter.com/j3w0beuU0X Former BSP MLAs Vijay Kumar and Alok Kumar join Samajwadi party: ANI 04:31 PM (IST) Uttar Pradesh CM Akhilesh Yadav to release SP's manifesto at 11am on Sunday: ANI 02:48 PM (IST) Several AAP founder members and leaders led by its former State IT Cell in-charge Himanshu Pathak resign enmasse, reports TOI's IP Singh. 01:43 PM (IST) Mulayam Singh's aide Ambika Chaudhary joins Bahujan Samaj Party 
In a stunning political development senior   leader and minister Ambika Chaudhary joined Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP) on Saturday. Chaudhary walked into BSP office when Mayawati was addressing a press conference. He said that he decided to shift his loyalties towards BSP because of the feud in the SP camp. 01:36 PM (IST) 
"The election manifesto for Goa State Legislative Assembly polls would be released by our leader Jyotiraditya Scindia on January 23," All India Congress Committee Secretary Girish Chodankar told PTI. 12:41 PM (IST) Punjab elections: 12 with similar names are in fray from Ludhiana seats 
Having already fought some tough rivals, big shots fighting assembly elections from constituencies in Ludhiana may face some challenge from their namesakes too, who are in the fray as independent candidates. Twelve candidates with similar names are fighting the elections from Ludhiana this time. 12:41 PM (IST) Punjab elections: Arvind Kejriwal fooling voters with false promises, says President Pranab Mukherjee's daughter 
Addressing students of Kamla Lohtia College, here on Friday , Sharmistha said, " After fooling Delhiites, Kejriwal is now making false promises to people of Punjab. He is saying that he'll uproot the drug problem from Punjab, whereas his government has failed to tackle the same problem in Delhi. Thousands of street children in Delhi have become drug addicts." 12:40 PM (IST) Punjab elections: SAD candidate faces revolt in Ludhiana East 
A large number of SAD workers and office-bearers of its affiliated organizations on Friday protested against SAD candidate and sitting MLA from Ludhiana East Ranjit Singh Dhillon and resigned from their posts while declaring that they would not vote for him. 12:40 PM (IST) Punjab elections: Parkash Singh Badal sought 'friend' Amarinder's help in Lambi: Arvind Kejriwal 
Aam Aadmi Party's national convener Arvind Kejriwal on Friday claimed that anticipating defeat, Punjab Chief minister Parkash Singh Badal has sought help from "friend" state Congress chief Amarinder Singh in dividing anti-incumbency votes. Kejriwal also said that after his party wins the Assembly polls, it "does not matter who will be the chief minister", but it will be his "responsibility" to fulfill the promises made by AAP to people of Punjab. 12:36 PM (IST) UP elections: Samajwadi Party banks on Muslim-Yadav formula 
Focussing on its tested Muslim-Yadav (MY) formula, the Samajwadi Party has given tickets to 56 Muslims and 26 Yadavs in the first list of 208 candidates announced on Friday. The list released by party's national president Akhilesh Yadav has most of the 38 names, including Shivpal Yadav from Jaswantnagar in Etawah, recommended by SP patriarch Mulayam Singh Yadav. 12:36 PM (IST) 
A day after SP distanced itself from entering into an alliance with Rashtriya Lok Dal, the latter on Friday announced its decision of forging alliance with Janata Dal (U) and other smaller parties and contest all 403 assembly seats. 12:36 PM (IST) UP elections: Polls In Shadow Of Dry Run 
Spurned by Samajwadi Party and Congress, Ajit Singh-led Rashtriya Lok Dal and Bihar's ruling party JD(U) announced that they would contest all 403 seats in the state in alliance with some smaller outfits. Talking to TOI, JD(U) UP chief Suresh Niranjan Bhaiyyaji said that the party chief and Bihar chief minister Nitish Kumar had already made it very clear that liquor ban would be the party's prime issue. 12:32 PM (IST) Delhi: Congress CEC to take place at 5:15 PM to discuss upcoming elections in Uttar Pradesh, reports ANI. 12:12 PM (IST) UP Polls: Shivpal makes it to SP list, but Tipu rejects three Mulayam Singh Yadav nominees 
The first list of   candidates which was released on Friday has most of the 38 names which were recommended by party patriarch Mulayam Singh to his son and UP CM Akhilesh Yadav. These include Shivpal Yadav, who was ousted by Akhilesh as UP SP chief. He has been re-nominated from Jaswantnagar in Etawah. At least three nominees recommended by Mulayam were rejected by Akhilesh. 12:11 PM (IST) 24 Nainital villages to boycott polls 
Over 16,000 people living in 24 villages of Nainital district have in unison decided to boycott the Uttarakhand polls. The villagers feel that the polls are the right time to highlight their woes, as it is during this period that politicians "wake up" from the "slumber" and come asking for votes. 12:11 PM (IST) In UP, small allies with big ambitions give BJP heartache 
As negotiations with the Apna Dal faction of Anupriya Patel and Om Prakash Rajbhar's Suheldev Bharatiya Samaj Party continue, BJP has been forced to postpone release of its second list of candidates even as notification for the first phase of assembly polls has been issued. 12:10 PM (IST) Sugar baron loses 15kg for effective campaigning 
Punjab's richest candidate in the February 4 election, sugar baron Rana Gurjit Singh went for a weight loss programme to Britain last year as he was finding it difficult to take on the rough and tumble of rural Punjab with extra flab. The three-time Congress MLA from Kapurthala has shed 15kg since October when he weighed 92kg. 12:09 PM (IST) SP-Congress alliance hits rough patch; Priyanka sends emissary to Akhilesh 
The bid to salvage the situation came after SP dropped a bombshell by releasing two lists+ of 210 candidates, including nine seats held by the Congress and the seats falling in the Gandhi borough of Amethi and Rae Bareli, a clear no-go area if an alliance is to come about. SP sources said the emissary — Dheeraj — is lodged in a Lucknow hotel and waiting for a call from the chief minister. Congress leaders confirmed Priyanka's intervention but did not provide details on the emissary. 09:02 PM (IST) Election Commission of India transfers 13 DMs and 9 SSPs in Uttar Pradesh From around the web More from The Times of India Recommended By Colombia
